inclusion.I1: Sample- The analysis must be on a healthy adult participants (alone, not a clinical or special group, or a comparison between healthy and clinical/special groups).
inclusion.I2: Whole-brain evidence- The analysis must be from a group-level, univariate whole-brain (voxelwise) task-evoked statistical map (e.g., main effect or within-group contrast) that is from the healthy/control group and is generalizable to the healthy adult population.

exclusion.E2: Seed-based connectivity, effective connectivity (e.g., PPI, DCM), or resting-state analyses (e.g., ICA, PLE, Hurst exponents)
exclusion.E3: Between-group contrasts or interactions (e.g., subgroup vs subgroup, patient vs control)

inclusion.I1: Analyses performed a social-related task. Relevant constructs include (but are not limited to) Affiliation and Attachment, Social Communication, Perception and Understanding of Self, and Perception and Understanding of Others.
inclusion.I2: The analysis/contrast must measure Social Processing

inclusion.I1: Analyses must be on a task measuring affiliation and attachment (example tasks: Kinship-related social scenarios; Cooperation and competition; Social comparison)
inclusion.I2: The analysis/contrast must measure Affiliation and Attachment (example contrast: Loved one vs Stranger)

inclusion.I1: Analyses from tasks measuring Social Communication (example tasks: Viewing picures of faces; Emotion, Auditory Stimuli; Direct or aveted eye gaze; Hand mimmicking)
inclusion.I2: The analysis/contrast must measure Social Communication (example contrast: Faces > non-faces)

inclusion.I1: Analyses from tasks measuring Perception and Understanding of Self (example tasks: Self-judgment; Viewing pictures of self; Detecting affective touch; Thinking about the self vs others)
inclusion.I2: The analysis/contrast must measure Perception and Understanding of Self (example contrast: Self > Other)

inclusion.I1: Analyses from tasks measuring Perception and Understanding of Others (example tasks: Empathy related; Theory of Mind; Compassion ratings; Point-light biological motion)
inclusion.I2: The analysis/contrast must measure Perception and Understanding of Others (example contrast: Cooperative > Neutral)
